      • readLineSplitMin

        public static java.lang.String[] readLineSplitMin(java.lang.String regex,
                                                  int min)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Read a line from the BufferedReader, split it around regex and check if the amount of Strings is at least min
        Parameters:
        regex - regular expression to split around
        min - minimum amount of resulting Strings
        Returns:
        String[] with the line read split at regex
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws if the number of resulting Strings is less than min

      • readLineSplitEquals

        public static java.lang.String[] readLineSplitEquals(java.lang.String regex,
                                                     int equal)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Read a line from the BufferedReader, split it around regex and check if the amount of Strings is equal to equal
        Parameters:
        regex - regular expression to split around
        equal - amount of resulting Strings
        Returns:
        String[] with the line read split at regex
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws if the number of resulting Strings is not equal to equal
